code:
sequenceDiagram
    actor User
    participant Browser
    participant NextServer as "Next.js Server"
    participant Solr as "Solr"
    participant Mongo as "MongoDB"
    participant ES as "Elasticsearch"

    User->>Browser: Enters search query and submits
    Browser->>+NextServer: GET /api/[IoT_Industrial_TelemetryStream]/artworks?q=...
    NextServer->>+Solr: searchArtworks(IoT_Industrial_TelemetryStream)
    Solr-->>-NextServer: Return search results
    NextServer-->>-Browser: Return JSON with artwork list
    Browser->>User: Display search results

    User->>Browser: Clicks on an artwork
    Browser->>+NextServer: GET /[IoT_Industrial_MQTT_Broker]/artworks/[IoT_Industrial_MQTT_Broker] (IoT_Industrial_MQTT_Broker)
    NextServer->>+Mongo: getArtworkById(IoT_Industrial_TelemetryStream)
    Mongo-->>-NextServer: Return full artwork document
    NextServer-->>-Browser: Return HTML page with artwork details
    Browser->>User: Display artwork detail page

    User->>Browser: Asks question about artwork
    Browser->>+NextServer: POST /api/[IoT_Industrial_ActuatorController]/rag/answer/artwork/[IoT_Industrial_TelemetryStream]
    NextServer->>+OpenAI: Generate embedding for query
    OpenAI-->>-NextServer: Return query embedding
    NextServer->>+ES: hybridSearch(IoT_Industrial_EdgeNode)
    ES-->>-NextServer: Return relevant chunks
    NextServer->>+OpenAI: Generate answer with LLM (IoT_Industrial_MQTT_Broker)
    OpenAI-->>-NextServer: Return generated answer
    NextServer-->>-Browser: Return answer with citations
    Browser->>User: Display chatbot response

    %% Notes
    %% - This diagram shows a typical user journey: searching for an item, viewing its detail page, and asking questions.
    %% - The initial search is powered by Solr.
    %% - The detail page view fetches the complete, authoritative data from MongoDB.
    %% - The RAG chatbot uses OpenAI for both embedding generation and LLM-based answer synthesis.
    %% - Elasticsearch performs hybrid search (IoT_Industrial_EdgeNode) to find relevant information chunks.
    %% - The Next.js server handles both data fetching via API routes and server-side rendering of pages.
